answers.answer: After some tests I have been diagnosed with pre eclampsia, I am 21 weeks and 2 days pregnant. I experience the headaches, rapid heart beat, upper abdominal pain, floaters and blurred vision, if it was all you were experiencing I would say you can wait to see your Dr. On Tuesday, but to be honest due to the vomiting I would suggest you follow orders and head to the hospital its always better to be safe, so what if you are there a couple hrs. Pre eclampsia can be something you can deal with at home, but also something more serious and you wont know until you are seen by a Doctor, wishing.you the best of luck and sending prayers your way.

I would go to the hospital too. I had a lot of halmark signs of preeclampsia starting at week 31, now week 33and my drs have found that I have a major asthma exacerbation due to hormones. A lot of the symptoms are simmilar to preeclampsia, and can be dangerous to the baby :(I really hope that what your feeling is just a passing phase and that you start feeling better soon. Good luck xx

question: From 6:30 to 9:30 am I had strong cramps but I felt ok all day until 6:30 pm I got floaters in my vision then blurry vision then a headache then vomiting. Im 31 weeks and worried it's pre eclampsia. The hospital said I should come in but my husband says im overreacting. Help please
title: pre eclampsia?
